brewery.brewery_description: Brewing since 1849, Hook Norton Brewery is a proudly independent family owned, sixth generation brewery based in the heart of the Cotswold Hills that takes the very best of itâ€™s handcrafted brewing heritage and combines it with a thoroughly modern approach, to create a range of cask, keg and bottled core ales, seasonal ales and one off unique brews. Brewing on the same site and still housed in the original buildings, Hook Norton invite you to come and experienced the unique sights, sounds and smells of a historic brewery at work and share in our passion and commitment to beer. Keeping traditions alive we still use our shire horses to carry out weekly dray deliveries to our local pubs in Hook Norton. We offer brewery tours and tutored tastings along with a brewery shop selling beer, artisan gifts and merchandise and our Malthouse Kitchen restaurant.

beer.beer_description: Gluten free. Golden. Citrus. Crisp.

Pale, delicately fruity and refreshing, moderate bitterness and a spicy, noble aroma. Hooky Gold marries the traditional English hops Goldings and Fuggles with its American off-shoot Willamette, the king of aroma hops.

Pale, delicately fruity and refreshing, moderate bitterness and a spicy, noble aroma. Hooky Gold marries the traditional English hops Goldings and Fuggles with its American off-shoot Willamette, the king of aroma hops.

items.badge_description: Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!

It's time to give bottle shops some love by adding them as your purchased location. That's 95 check-ins with a purchased location! Tag 5 more to get to Level 20. Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

beer.beer_description: A strong pale ale of distinctive taste. Plenty of Goldings hops during the brewing give it a certain something extra - like sunshine dancing on the tongue.
A beautifully balanced beer, fruity by nature, with a well-rounded body and the suggestive echo of Crystal Malt.
A strong dark brown beer, offering a dominantly malty palate with nutty overtones, giving way to a lyrical sweetness that speaks for its strength.
A dark chestnut coloured ale, full of roast malt flavours, and complemented with superb dry-hop aromas from East Kent Goldings.

Honkingly good ale! A delightfully full flavoured beer, rich to the palate and displaying a rounded fruity aroma with hints of dark fruit, punching above its weight, this is a great beer for both the goose and the gander.

beer.beer_description: Honkingly good ale! A delightfully full flavoured beer, rich to the palate and displaying a rounded fruity aroma with hints of dark fruit, punching above its weight, this is a great beer for both the goose and the gander.

Double Stout with a double charge of coloured malts. Black malt enriches the colour and teases the palate, Brown malt gives it the dryness. Roasted almost coffee aromas, with a dry and oaky flavour. Cheers!

Taste tradition with a modern twist. Brewer Andy Thomas said â€˜We are very excited to be using Olicana in our special one-off 175 beer. We have used Olicana before and loved brewing with it for its tropical and floral notes. This variety in our eyes is on another level. Weâ€™ve combined it with Goldings, the UKâ€™s oldest variety and Fuggles, a mainstay of our Hooky beers over the years. Itâ€™s great to continue our longstanding association with Charles Faram.

See: Light amber
Smell: Floral, light passion fruit and grapefruit notes
Taste: Sweet toffee notes and a light fruity finish

beer.beer_description: A beautifully balanced beer, fruity by nature, with a well-rounded body and the suggestive echo of Crystal Malt.
Hooky is a subtly balanced, amber bitter, hoppy to the nose, malty on the palate - the classic session beer, eminently drinkable. Cheers!

Pale, delicately fruity and refreshing, moderate bitterness and a spicy, noble aroma. Hooky Gold marries the traditional English hops Goldings and Fuggles with its American off-shoot Willamette, the king of aroma hops.
A strong dark brown beer, offering a dominantly malty palate with nutty overtones, giving way to a lyrical sweetness that speaks for its strength.
A strong pale ale of distinctive taste. Plenty of Goldings hops during the brewing give it a certain something extra - like sunshine dancing on the tongue.

Double Stout with a double charge of coloured malts. Black malt enriches the colour and teases the palate, Brown malt gives it the dryness. Roasted almost coffee aromas, with a dry and oaky flavour. Cheers!
This seasonal IPA-style beer, originally brewed to celebrate the 200th anniversary of the Battle of Trafalgar, has a zesty, sweet aroma and a fruity mouthfeel, with a full hop character throughout.

Honkingly good ale! A delightfully full flavoured beer, rich to the palate and displaying a rounded fruity aroma with hints of dark fruit, punching above its weight, this is a great beer for both the goose and the gander.

A strong combination of citrus and orange notes delivering a full on refreshing beer.

Hops: Admiral, Challenger, Mandarina Bavaria, UK Chinook, U.S Amarillo
Malts: Pale
"Red in colour and so beautifully fruity by nature, you'd be forgiven for thinking this is one of your five a day. It's not.....but it should be!"
Previously brewed at 4.8% abv.
A dark chestnut coloured ale, full of roast malt flavours, and complemented with superb dry-hop aromas from East Kent Goldings.
This black as the bird beer is as smooth and dark as it's name sake. - Based on an original recipe, handed down through the generations. Maris Otter pale ale, black and brown malt, and oats.

Taste tradition with a modern twist. Brewer Andy Thomas said â€˜We are very excited to be using Olicana in our special one-off 175 beer. We have used Olicana before and loved brewing with it for its tropical and floral notes. This variety in our eyes is on another level. Weâ€™ve combined it with Goldings, the UKâ€™s oldest variety and Fuggles, a mainstay of our Hooky beers over the years. Itâ€™s great to continue our longstanding association with Charles Faram.

See: Light amber
Smell: Floral, light passion fruit and grapefruit notes
Taste: Sweet toffee notes and a light fruity finish
This ruby-coloured seasonal ale has an inviting floral aroma, while its use of Maris Otter malt, plus a touch of rye and wheat, delivers complexity to the soft dark fruit flavour.
Gluten free. Golden. Citrus. Crisp.
A variety of hops from around the world have been skilfully combined including English Cascade and Chinook for gentle bitterness.
Light and fruity, with a cosmopolitan hop burst, ideal summer refreshment. An al-fresco beer, serve as an aperitif, enjoy with a summer salad, and as a cleansing ale before retiring.
